p: Perfumery is the main consumer of rose oil. It is a product of double distillation and its composition varies within certain limits. The international standard ISO 9842 sets limits on the main ingredients for rose oil from R. damascena Mill. [ 37]. Due to the complexity of the composition, the standard is a necessary but insufficient quality criterion and serves rather as a rough guide in characterizing the oil. Chemically, it is a mixture of almost 300 compounds such as terpene and phenol derivatives of hydrocarbon compounds [ 38, 39]. A small number of sulfur-containing components have also been identified [ 40].
